critical_findings.issue_1_partial: Japanese hard cap works for TC001,003,005 but NOT TC013 - profile gate logic issue
critical_findings.issue_2_severe: Domain mismatch overscoring confirmed - TC006 scored 71 instead of <30
critical_findings.issue_3_confirmed: Risk flags lack standard prefixes in all cases
critical_findings.issue_4_minor: Confidence scoring conservative but mostly correct

refined_test_cases.name: Profile Japanese Gate Edge Case - PRIORITY FIX
refined_test_cases.jd_text:
Position: AI Project Manager
Company: Global Tech
Location: New York, NY

Responsibilities:
- Manage AI/ML implementation projects
- Coordinate stakeholder relationships
- Lead change management initiatives
- PMO reporting and governance

Requirements:
- 5+ years project management experience
- Experience with agile methodologies
- Strong communication skills
- Program governance experience

refined_expected.rationale: JD does NOT mention Japanese at all. Profile having 'Japanese (Business)' should NOT trigger hard cap. This is a false positive in the current logic.

fix_guidance.root_cause: profileRequiresJapaneseFluent incorrectly treats 'Japanese (Business)' as fluency requirement
fix_guidance.solution: Only trigger hard cap if profile explicitly requires fluent/native Japanese for work, not just having Japanese language skills

refined_expected.rationale: 71 is way too high for tech profile vs fashion retail. Generic skills inflating score.

refined_test_cases.name: Japanese Fluency Hard Cap - WORKING CORRECTLY

refined_expected.required_risk_flag_format: JAPANESE_FLUENCY: Hard gate: JD requires Japanese fluency...
ONSITE_REQUIRED: Hard gate: JD appears onsite-required...

refined_test_cases.name: High Fit AI Role - Confidence Should Be HIGH
